title: Social Adaptability and Professional Identity Formation Program for Nursing Students: Grounded in Citizenship and Medical Ethics

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational nursing theory, practical experience, interpersonal relationship-building skills, basic medical ethics comprehension, and awareness of civil rights
context.additional_context: A short-term program for pre-nursing teachers aged 40+ aiming to adapt to new roles and form professional identity. Strengthening awareness of rights and responsibilities as healthcare professionals while emphasizing community health promotion and cultural diversity values

learning_goals: Learners can analyze changes in societal expectations during role transitions and develop coping strategies considering cultural contexts and healthcare system changes.
Learners can enhance practical problem-solving skills in medical settings through peer collaborative learning strategies, applying team-based nursing protocols and patient-centered approaches.
Learners can design the professional identity formation process using instructor-learner interaction models, cultivating attitudes of medical ethics, patient rights respect, and civic responsibility.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
